channel.title: A very screwed up compile problem
channel.description:
K so me and my friend were updating his server over the internet, and he sent me his 3 files I needed. I updated them, and then put them on my server to see if there were any errors on compiler. I got this:
client(1).java:7: class client is public, should be declared in a file named cli ent.java public class client extends Player implements Runnable { ^ NPCHandler(1).java:4: class NPCHandler is public, should be declared in a file n amed NPCHandler.java public class NPCHandler { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
-- Yet I have public class client extends Player implements Runnable { on both of them!
Now, I delete public off public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
so it has class client extends Player implements Runnable {
Compiler worked, 1 left. I did the exact same for NPC Handler, and compiler worked. I ran my test server, and it said autospawn.cfg: file could not be found.
How do I fix this??!?! Please help =(

item.title: A very screwed up compile problem
item.dc:creator: @rawrnezz rawrnezz
item.description:
@rawrnezz wrote:

Thats the problem, autospawn.cfg is there.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2008, 09:18:30 pm[/size][hr]OMFG! NVM! It turns out, it was reading client.java(1) as we were doing this over the internet. All I did was delete (1) and it worked… thread closed lol!

Read full topic
item.source: A very screwed up compile problem

How do I fix this??!?! Please help =([/quote]
Wow… Make a file called autospawn.cfg so it can find it maybe?
m

item.title: A very screwed up compile problem
item.dc:creator: @rawrnezz rawrnezz
item.description:
@rawrnezz wrote:

K so me and my friend were updating his server over the internet, and he sent me his 3 files I needed. I updated them, and then put them on my server to see if there were any errors on compiler. I got this:

client(1).java:7: class client is public, should be declared in a file named cli
ent.java
public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
^
NPCHandler(1).java:4: class NPCHandler is public, should be declared in a file n
amed NPCHandler.java
public class NPCHandler {
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

–
Yet I have public class client extends Player implements Runnable { on both of them!

Now, I delete public off
public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

so it has class client extends Player implements Runnable {

Compiler worked, 1 left. I did the exact same for NPC Handler, and compiler worked. I ran my test server, and it said autospawn.cfg: file could not be found.

How do I fix this??!?! Please help =(
